availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Kennedy (Convicted of the rape of Elizabeth Franklin in Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky, on February 12, 1862.)

body.p: Convicted of the rape of Elizabeth Franklin in Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky, on February 12, 1862. Pardoned by Governor Thomas E. Bramlette on April 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
"Mayor's Office," Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), September 4, 1861, p. 3.
"Unsuccessful Attempt to Break Jail," Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), October 21, 1861, p. 3.
"Circuit Court," _Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), February 7, 1862, p. 3.
"Circuit Court," Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), February 12, 1862, p. 3.
"Convicted," Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), February 13, 1862, p. 3.
